question:
The abilities of microorganisms to adapt to sweeping environmental changes are more $\(\qquad\)$ than is commonly thought: from self-induced rapid mutations that allow them to utilize novel nutrient sources, to the appropriation of other microbe communities, their innovative capabilities know no end.
Two Answers
A. ineffectual
B. profuse
C. advantageous
D. prolific
E. beneficial
F. accommodating
